paper: Reinforcement Learning in Different Phases of Quantum Control
goal: load a nonintegrable interacting quantum system into a desired target state

construct.title: Reinforcement Learning in Different Phases of Quantum Control
construct.author: Bukov, Marin and Day, Alexandre G. R. and Sels, Dries and Weinberg, Phillip and Polkovnikov, Anatoli and Mehta, Pankaj

Reinforcement learning.description: a modified version of Watkins online, off-policy Q-learning algorithm with linear function approximation and eligibility traces

single-qubit manipulation.purpose(before): to benchmark the application of RL to physics problems
purpose: benchmark the protocol obtained by RL agent.
reveal an important novel perspective on the complexity of quantum-state manipulation.

performance metric.To study the correlations between the in: correlator: $q(T)=\frac{1}{16 N_T} \sum_{j=1}^{N_T} \overline{\left\{h_x(j \delta t)-\overline{h_x}(j \delta t)\right\}^2}$(the behavior of the correlator q(T) show in Fig. 1)

explanation(è¯´æ˜Ž): one can construct infinitely many protocols which prepare the target state with unit fidelity, and the problem is in the controllable phase III
In this phase, there is a proliferation of exactly degenerate, uncorrelated global infidelity minima corresponding to protocols of unit fidelity, and the optimization task is easy.
